alert.note: Alert for Orange; Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:56PM EST until January 11 at 8:30PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in New York NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Jersey...New York... Ramapo River near Mahwah affecting Bergen, Passaic, Orange and Rockland Counties. For the Ramapo River...including Mahwah...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ramapo River near Mahwah. * WHEN...From late tonight to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, State Route 202 floods downstream. Moderate flooding along Route 202 and Route 17. Water into backyards. Minor flooding along Brakeshoe Place, Brook Street and Catherine Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 9.5 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 04/17/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Ramapo River Mahwah 8.0 4.1 Tue 2 pm EST 9.5 8.1 6.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 300 AM EST.
